title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.3. ENABLING ENVIRONMENT EDUCATION

description.narrative: By end 2021, national, regional and local authorities have the knowledge and capacity to plan, coordinate, implement, monitor and evaluate implementation of the 10-year Education and Literacy Development Plan, taking into account the human rights-based approach, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By the end of 2021, the most vulnerable preschool and school-age children, adolescents and young people, of both sexes, in the 10 targeted provinces make greater use of inclusive, quality educational services, for improved learning outcomes and receive certification for this.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, national, regional and local authorities have the knowledge and capacity to plan, coordinate, implement, monitor and evaluate implementation of the 10-year Education and Literacy Development Plan, taking into account the human rights-based approach

description.narrative: In 2019, the Ministry of Education (MENPC) was able to collect and process statistical data for the years 2017/18 and 2018/19, and the decentralized authorities continued to prepare their beginning- and end-of-year reports. Several provinces have also started to develop Provincial Development Plans (PPD) including education, with support from UNICEF. However, capacities still need to be strengthened, as do the links between PPD and the Intermediary Education Plan (PIET) 2018-2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/02/2020
